name: Paris
clues: Home to a famous tower finished in 1889
Called the City of Light
funFacts: The Louvre is the world's largest art museum.
Famous for café culture and haute cuisine.

name: New York City
clues: Home to a green statue gifted by France in the 1800s
Nicknamed 'The Big Apple' and known for its Broadway theaters
funFacts: Times Square was once called Longacre Square before being renamed in 1904.
The Empire State Building has its own zip code: 10118.

name: Tokyo
clues: Capital city with over 13 million residents
Known for high-tech, anime, and cherry blossoms
funFacts: It's the most populous metropolitan area in the world.
Tsukiji once was the world's largest fish market.

name: Rome
clues: Home to the Colosseum, an ancient gladiator arena
This city has an independent country within it
funFacts: Rome’s Trevi Fountain collects around €3,000 in coins daily, which is donated to charity.
The Vatican City, located in Rome, is the smallest country in the world.

name: London
clues: Home to a famous clock tower often mistaken for its bell
A city where red double-decker buses and black cabs are iconic
funFacts: Big Ben is actually the name of the bell inside the clock tower, not the tower itself.
The London Underground, opened in 1863, is the world’s oldest subway system.

name: Bangkok
clues: Home to a grand palace and a reclining Buddha
Famous for its street food and floating markets
funFacts: Bangkok’s full ceremonial name is one of the longest city names in the world.
The city has more than 400 temples, making it a spiritual hub.

name: Dubai
clues: Home to the tallest building in the world
Famous for luxury shopping, skyscrapers, and desert adventures
funFacts: The Burj Khalifa stands at an astonishing 828 meters (2,717 feet).
Dubai has an indoor ski resort inside a shopping mall.

name: Barcelona
clues: Home to an unfinished basilica designed by Antoni Gaudí
Famous for its beaches, football team, and vibrant culture
funFacts: La Sagrada Familia has been under construction for over 140 years.
Barcelona banned bullfighting in 2012, despite its historical significance in Spain.

name: Istanbul
clues: The only city that spans two continents
Famous for its grand market and historic mosques
funFacts: Istanbul’s Grand Bazaar has over 4,000 shops, making it one of the largest and oldest markets in the world.
Hagia Sophia has been both a church and a mosque throughout history.

name: Amsterdam
clues: A city known for its canals and cycling culture
Home to Anne Frank’s house and the Van Gogh Museum
funFacts: Amsterdam has more bicycles than residents.
The city’s canals span over 100 kilometers, with more bridges than Venice.

name: Singapore
clues: Famous for its futuristic skyline and Marina Bay Sands
Home to one of the world's best airport experiences
funFacts: Singapore is one of the cleanest cities in the world.
The city has a 'supertree' garden with massive artificial trees.

name: Kuala Lumpur
clues: Home to the tallest twin towers in the world
A city famous for its mix of modern skyscrapers and colonial buildings
funFacts: The Petronas Towers were the tallest buildings in the world until 2004.
Kuala Lumpur means 'Muddy Confluence' in Malay.

name: Hong Kong
clues: Famous for its Victoria Harbour and towering skyline
A city where East meets West in culture and cuisine
funFacts: Hong Kong has more skyscrapers than any other city in the world.
The Peak Tram has been operating since 1888.

name: Sydney
clues: Home to a world-famous opera house with a sail-like design
Known for its stunning harbour and beaches
funFacts: The Sydney Opera House has over a million tiles on its roof.
Bondi Beach is one of the most famous beaches in the world.

name: Berlin
clues: Home to a historic wall that once divided the city
Known for its vibrant art, history, and nightlife
funFacts: Berlin has more bridges than Venice.
The Brandenburg Gate was once a symbol of division, now unity.

name: Vienna
clues: A city famous for classical music and imperial palaces
Once home to Mozart, Beethoven, and Sigmund Freud
funFacts: Vienna has been ranked the world's most livable city multiple times.
The Viennese coffee culture is recognized by UNESCO.

name: Prague
clues: Known as the 'City of a Hundred Spires'
Famous for its medieval Old Town and historic bridge
funFacts: The Charles Bridge is lined with 30 baroque statues.
Prague Castle is the largest ancient castle in the world.

name: Moscow
clues: Home to a famous square and colorful onion-domed cathedral
Capital of the world's largest country by land area
funFacts: The Moscow Metro stations are known for their stunning architecture.
The Kremlin has five palaces and four cathedrals inside.

name: Seoul
clues: A city blending ancient palaces with futuristic skyscrapers
Known for its K-pop and street food scene
funFacts: Seoul has the world’s fastest internet speeds.
The city has over 3,700 coffee shops in the Gangnam district alone.

name: Lisbon
clues: Capital of Portugal, known for its trams and pastel buildings
Famous for its historic yellow trams and Fado music
funFacts: Lisbon is one of the oldest cities in Europe, predating Rome and London.
The city's iconic Tram 28 takes visitors through its most scenic neighborhoods.

name: Athens
clues: Home to the ancient Acropolis and Parthenon
Birthplace of democracy and Western philosophy
funFacts: Athens is one of the world’s oldest cities, with history dating back over 3,400 years.
The Olympic Games were revived in Athens in 1896.

name: Buenos Aires
clues: Known as the 'Paris of South America' for its architecture
Famous for tango dancing and steak
funFacts: Buenos Aires has the most bookstores per capita in the world.
The city has a unique cemetery, Recoleta, where Eva Perón is buried.

name: Rio de Janeiro
clues: Famous for its massive Christ the Redeemer statue
Known for its Copacabana and Ipanema beaches
funFacts: Rio’s Carnival is the biggest in the world, attracting millions each year.
The city’s name means 'River of January,' but it has no major river.

name: Cape Town
clues: Famous for Table Mountain and Robben Island
Located at the southern tip of Africa
funFacts: Cape Town is home to one of the world’s most diverse floral kingdoms.
Robben Island, where Nelson Mandela was imprisoned, is a UNESCO site.

name: Cairo
clues: Home to the Great Pyramids of Giza
One of the largest cities in Africa and the Middle East
funFacts: The pyramids were the tallest structures in the world for over 3,800 years.
Cairo’s Khan el-Khalili is one of the oldest markets in the world.

name: Marrakech
clues: Known as the 'Red City' for its terracotta buildings
Famous for its bustling souks and historic palaces
funFacts: The Medina of Marrakech is a UNESCO World Heritage site.
Jemaa el-Fnaa square comes alive with performers and food stalls every evening.

name: Mexico City
clues: Built on the ruins of the ancient Aztec capital, Tenochtitlán
Home to one of the largest public squares in the world
funFacts: Mexico City sinks about 50 cm per year due to its foundation on a former lake.
The city has more museums than any other capital in the world.

name: Toronto
clues: Home to the CN Tower, once the world's tallest tower
A city with one of the most diverse populations in the world
funFacts: More than 180 languages are spoken in Toronto.
Toronto has a massive underground city called PATH, with over 30 km of walkways.

name: Dublin
clues: Home to the famous Guinness Storehouse
Famous for its historic pubs and Trinity College
funFacts: Dublin’s Trinity College Library houses the Book of Kells, a 9th-century manuscript.
There are more than 750 pubs in the city.

name: Edinburgh
clues: Home to a famous medieval castle on a volcanic rock
The city inspired J.K. Rowling to write Harry Potter
funFacts: Edinburgh hosts the world’s largest arts festival, the Edinburgh Fringe.
The Royal Mile is actually slightly longer than a mile.

name: Venice
clues: A city built on over 100 small islands with canals instead of roads
Famous for gondola rides and the Grand Canal
funFacts: Venice has over 400 bridges connecting its islands.
The city is gradually sinking due to rising sea levels.

name: Stockholm
clues: Built on 14 islands connected by over 50 bridges
Home to the Nobel Prize award ceremony
funFacts: Stockholm’s subway is often called the 'world’s longest art gallery' due to its decorated stations.
The city has a museum dedicated to ABBA, Sweden’s famous pop group.

name: Copenhagen
clues: Famous for its colorful Nyhavn harbor
Home to a famous statue of a mermaid
funFacts: Copenhagen is one of the most bike-friendly cities in the world.
The Tivoli Gardens amusement park inspired Walt Disney’s Disneyland.

name: Brussels
clues: Home to the headquarters of the European Union
Famous for waffles, chocolate, and a statue of a little boy peeing
funFacts: The Atomium was originally built for the 1958 World Expo.
Brussels is home to over 800 brands of beer.

name: Helsinki
clues: Capital of Finland, known for its saunas and design
Located on the shores of the Baltic Sea
funFacts: Helsinki has more than 3 million saunas—more than its total population.
The city hosts an annual wife-carrying championship.

name: Oslo
clues: Home to the Viking Ship Museum and Nobel Peace Prize ceremony
Surrounded by fjords and forests
funFacts: Oslo was founded over 1,000 years ago and was originally called 'Christiania.'
The Oslo Opera House allows visitors to walk on its sloping roof.

name: Warsaw
clues: Rebuilt almost entirely after World War II
Home to the largest castle in Poland
funFacts: The Old Town was reconstructed based on old paintings after being destroyed in WWII.
Marie Curie, the first woman to win a Nobel Prize, was born in Warsaw.

name: Budapest
clues: Divided by the Danube River into two parts: Buda and Pest
Famous for its thermal baths and ruin bars
funFacts: The Chain Bridge was the first to permanently connect Buda and Pest.
Budapest has the largest underground cave system in Europe.

name: Zagreb
clues: Capital of Croatia, known for its red-roofed buildings
Home to one of the quirkiest museums in the world
funFacts: Zagreb’s Museum of Broken Relationships is dedicated to failed love stories.
The city’s trams have been in operation since 1891.

name: Belgrade
clues: Capital of Serbia, located at the confluence of the Danube and Sava rivers
Known for its vibrant nightlife and historic fortress
funFacts: Belgrade is one of the oldest cities in Europe, dating back to 279 BC.
The city has been destroyed and rebuilt more than 40 times.

name: Ljubljana
clues: Capital of Slovenia, known for its dragon symbolism
Famous for its pedestrian-friendly Old Town and green spaces
funFacts: Ljubljana was awarded the title of European Green Capital in 2016.
The city's castle offers panoramic views of the entire region.

name: Bucharest
clues: Known as 'Little Paris' due to its elegant architecture
Home to the massive Palace of the Parliament
funFacts: Bucharest’s Palace of the Parliament is the second-largest administrative building in the world.
The city’s Old Town is one of the liveliest entertainment districts in Europe.

name: Sofia
clues: Capital of Bulgaria, located at the foot of Vitosha Mountain
Home to one of the oldest churches in Europe, St. George Rotunda
funFacts: Sofia is one of the oldest capitals in Europe, dating back over 7,000 years.
It has more than 40 mineral springs within the city.

name: Tallinn
clues: Capital of Estonia, known for its medieval Old Town
A hub for digital innovation and tech startups
funFacts: Tallinn’s Old Town is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Estonia was the first country to allow online voting in elections.

name: Vilnius
clues: Capital of Lithuania, famous for its Baroque architecture
Home to the self-proclaimed 'Republic of Užupis'
funFacts: Vilnius has one of the largest medieval Old Towns in Europe.
The city’s Užupis district has its own flag, anthem, and 'president.'

name: Riga
clues: Capital of Latvia, known for its Art Nouveau buildings
Located on the shores of the Baltic Sea
funFacts: Riga has over 800 Art Nouveau buildings, the highest concentration in the world.
The city’s Central Market is one of Europe’s largest and is housed in old Zeppelin hangars.

name: Bratislava
clues: Capital of Slovakia, situated along the Danube River
Known for its charming Old Town and castle overlooking the city
funFacts: Bratislava is the only capital in the world that borders two other countries (Austria and Hungary).
The city’s UFO Tower offers panoramic views from 95 meters high.

name: Bern
clues: Capital of Switzerland, famous for its well-preserved medieval architecture
Home to the famous Bear Park
funFacts: Einstein developed his Theory of Relativity while living in Bern.
Bern’s Old Town is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Kraków
clues: One of Poland’s most historic cities, home to Wawel Castle
Famous for its well-preserved medieval market square
funFacts: Kraków’s Main Market Square is the largest medieval square in Europe.
The city is known for its legendary fire-breathing dragon.

name: Lima
clues: Capital of Peru, known for its coastal cliffs and colonial history
Home to one of the best culinary scenes in the world
funFacts: Lima is the only capital city in South America located on the Pacific coast.
The city is famous for its ceviche, a raw seafood dish.

name: Santiago
clues: Capital of Chile, located at the foot of the Andes
Home to South America’s tallest skyscraper, Gran Torre Santiago
funFacts: Santiago’s metro system features an underground art gallery.
The city is surrounded by some of the world’s best wine regions.

name: Bogotá
clues: Capital of Colombia, known for its high altitude
Famous for its vibrant street art and historical La Candelaria district
funFacts: Bogotá is one of the highest capitals in the world at 2,640 meters above sea level.
The city’s Gold Museum holds the largest collection of pre-Hispanic gold artifacts.

name: Quito
clues: Capital of Ecuador, located high in the Andes
One of the best-preserved colonial cities in South America
funFacts: Quito is the closest capital city to the equator.
The city’s Old Town is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Caracas
clues: Capital of Venezuela, located in a valley surrounded by mountains
Home to the birthplace of Simón Bolívar
funFacts: Caracas has the world’s longest cable car system.
The city is located just 15 km from the Caribbean coast.

name: La Paz
clues: One of the highest capital cities in the world
Famous for its colorful street markets and cable cars
funFacts: La Paz is the highest capital city at 3,640 meters above sea level.
It has a unique public transport system of cable cars called 'Mi Teleférico.'

name: Montevideo
clues: Capital of Uruguay, known for its coastal promenade
Famous for its laid-back lifestyle and mate tea culture
funFacts: Montevideo has the longest continuous sidewalk in the world, the Rambla.
It’s the southernmost capital in South America.

name: Asunción
clues: Capital of Paraguay, located on the Paraguay River
One of the oldest cities in South America
funFacts: Asunción was founded in 1537, making it one of the oldest Spanish settlements.
The city is known for its colonial architecture and lively markets.

name: San José
clues: Capital of Costa Rica, known for its volcanoes and rainforests
A gateway to eco-tourism adventures
funFacts: San José has no army—Costa Rica abolished its military in 1948.
The city’s National Theater was built using coffee export profits.

name: Havana
clues: Capital of Cuba, known for its colorful colonial buildings
Famous for vintage cars and lively music
funFacts: Havana’s Old Town is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Cuba produces some of the world’s finest cigars.

name: Kingston
clues: Capital of Jamaica, known as the birthplace of reggae
Home to the Bob Marley Museum
funFacts: Kingston is the largest English-speaking city in the Caribbean.
It has the seventh-largest natural harbor in the world.

name: San Juan
clues: Capital of Puerto Rico, known for its colorful Spanish colonial buildings
Home to the historic El Morro fortress
funFacts: San Juan is the oldest city under U.S. jurisdiction.
It was founded in 1521 by Spanish explorers.

name: Panama City
clues: Capital of Panama, famous for the Panama Canal
A modern skyline combined with a historic Old Town
funFacts: Panama City is the only capital with a rainforest within city limits.
The Panama Canal connects the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans.

name: Managua
clues: Capital of Nicaragua, located near Lake Managua
Home to many volcanoes and seismic activity
funFacts: Managua was almost entirely rebuilt after a 1972 earthquake.
The city’s name means 'near the water' in Nahuatl.

name: Tegucigalpa
clues: Capital of Honduras, surrounded by mountains
Home to colonial-era churches and plazas
funFacts: The city’s name is believed to mean 'silver mountain' in Nahuatl.
Tegucigalpa and its twin city Comayagüela are divided by the Choluteca River.

name: Guatemala City
clues: Largest city in Central America
Home to ancient Mayan ruins at Kaminaljuyu
funFacts: Guatemala City was founded in 1776 after an earthquake destroyed Antigua.
The city sits on the site of an ancient Mayan settlement.

name: San Salvador
clues: Capital of El Salvador, located near volcanoes
Known for its bustling markets and historic churches
funFacts: San Salvador has experienced multiple earthquakes throughout history.
The city’s Metropolitan Cathedral houses the tomb of Archbishop Óscar Romero.

name: Port-au-Prince
clues: Capital of Haiti, located on the Gulf of Gonâve
Known for its vibrant art scene and historic landmarks
funFacts: Port-au-Prince was named after a French ship called 'Le Prince.'
The Iron Market is a symbol of the city's resilience.

name: Accra
clues: Capital of Ghana, located along the Atlantic coast
Home to historic forts and lively markets
funFacts: Accra was originally built around three European trading forts.
It is known for its fabric markets and kente cloth production.

name: Dakar
clues: Capital of Senegal, located on the Cape Verde Peninsula
Known for its rich musical heritage and vibrant culture
funFacts: Dakar is the westernmost capital in mainland Africa.
The city is famous for the annual Dakar Rally race.

name: Lagos
clues: Largest city in Nigeria and one of the fastest-growing cities in the world
Known for its bustling markets and nightlife
funFacts: Lagos was the capital of Nigeria until 1991.
The city has Africa’s largest economy and busiest ports.

name: Nairobi
clues: Capital of Kenya, known as the 'Green City in the Sun'
Home to a national park where you can see wildlife against a city skyline
funFacts: Nairobi is the only capital city with a national park within city limits.
It is a major hub for African wildlife conservation efforts.

name: Addis Ababa
clues: Capital of Ethiopia and the diplomatic hub of Africa
Home to the headquarters of the African Union
funFacts: Addis Ababa means 'New Flower' in Amharic.
The city sits at 2,355 meters above sea level, making it one of the highest capitals in the world.

name: Kigali
clues: Capital of Rwanda, known for its cleanliness and safety
Home to the Kigali Genocide Memorial
funFacts: Kigali has been ranked as one of the cleanest cities in Africa.
It is often called the 'Singapore of Africa' due to its rapid development.

name: Victoria Falls
clues: One of the largest waterfalls in the world, located between Zimbabwe and Zambia
Known locally as 'Mosi-oa-Tunya' meaning 'The Smoke That Thunders'
funFacts: Victoria Falls is over twice the height of Niagara Falls.
The waterfall creates a permanent rainbow due to its mist.

name: Algiers
clues: Capital of Algeria, known for its whitewashed buildings
A mix of French colonial and Moorish architecture
funFacts: Algiers is sometimes called 'Algiers the White' due to its bright buildings.
It has one of the largest Kasbahs in North Africa, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Tunis
clues: Capital of Tunisia, located on the Mediterranean coast
Home to the ancient ruins of Carthage
funFacts: Tunis' Medina is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
The city was once a major hub of the Carthaginian Empire.

name: Muscat
clues: Capital of Oman, known for its stunning coastline
A blend of traditional Arab culture and modernity
funFacts: Muscat’s Grand Mosque can accommodate over 20,000 worshippers.
The city’s name means 'safe anchorage' in Arabic.

name: Riyadh
clues: Capital of Saudi Arabia, located in the desert
Home to modern skyscrapers like the Kingdom Centre
funFacts: Riyadh means 'gardens' in Arabic.
It is one of the hottest cities in the world, with summer temperatures often exceeding 45°C.

name: Amman
clues: Capital of Jordan, known for its ancient ruins
A gateway to the famous city of Petra
funFacts: Amman was originally called 'Philadelphia' in ancient times.
The city is built on seven hills.

name: Beirut
clues: Capital of Lebanon, known as the 'Paris of the Middle East'
Famous for its vibrant nightlife and historic sites
funFacts: Beirut is one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world.
The city was destroyed and rebuilt seven times due to earthquakes and wars.

name: Doha
clues: Capital of Qatar, known for its futuristic skyline
Home to the Museum of Islamic Art and The Pearl-Qatar
funFacts: Doha hosted the 2022 FIFA World Cup.
The city has some of the highest per capita incomes in the world.

name: Jerusalem
clues: A city sacred to Judaism, Christianity, and Islam
Home to the Western Wall, Dome of the Rock, and Church of the Holy Sepulchre
funFacts: Jerusalem is one of the oldest cities in the world, dating back over 3,000 years.
It has over 60 different religious and historical sites.

name: Kathmandu
clues: Capital of Nepal, located in a valley surrounded by mountains
Gateway to Mount Everest and the Himalayas
funFacts: Kathmandu is home to seven UNESCO World Heritage Sites.
The city's Durbar Square features stunning ancient palaces and temples.

name: Malé
clues: Capital of the Maldives, known for its colorful buildings
One of the world's most densely populated cities
funFacts: Malé is only 1.3 square kilometers in size.
The Maldives is the lowest-lying country in the world, with an average ground level of just 1.5 meters above sea level.

name: Baku
clues: Capital of Azerbaijan, located on the Caspian Sea
A mix of medieval, Soviet, and modern architecture
funFacts: Baku is the lowest-lying national capital in the world at 28 meters below sea level.
It is known for the Flame Towers, which light up the city's skyline.

name: Tbilisi
clues: Capital of Georgia, famous for its hot springs
A city with diverse architecture, from medieval to modern
funFacts: Tbilisi's name means 'warm place' due to its sulfur baths.
The city was founded in the 5th century by King Vakhtang I Gorgasali.

name: Yerevan
clues: Capital of Armenia, one of the oldest cities in the world
Home to Republic Square and Mount Ararat views
funFacts: Yerevan is older than Rome, dating back to 782 BC.
Known as the 'Pink City' due to its buildings made from volcanic tuff stone.

name: Tashkent
clues: Capital of Uzbekistan, known for its Soviet-era architecture
A key stop on the ancient Silk Road
funFacts: Tashkent means 'Stone City' in Turkic languages.
It is the most populous city in Central Asia.

name: Ashgabat
clues: Capital of Turkmenistan, known for its white marble buildings
One of the least-visited capitals in the world
funFacts: Ashgabat holds the Guinness World Record for the highest concentration of white marble buildings.
It was almost completely destroyed by an earthquake in 1948.

name: Ulaanbaatar
clues: Capital of Mongolia, the world's coldest capital
A mix of modern city life and nomadic traditions
funFacts: Ulaanbaatar means 'Red Hero' in Mongolian.
Over 40% of Mongolia's population lives in the city.

name: Colombo
clues: Largest city in Sri Lanka, located on the Indian Ocean
A vibrant mix of colonial history and modern skyscrapers
funFacts: Colombo was once ruled by the Portuguese, Dutch, and British.
It is famous for its tea exports and coastal beauty.

name: Hanoi
clues: Capital of Vietnam, known for its centuries-old architecture
Home to Hoan Kiem Lake and the Old Quarter
funFacts: Hanoi has been the capital of Vietnam for over 1,000 years.
It is famous for its street food, including pho and egg coffee.

name: Jakarta
clues: Capital of Indonesia, one of the most densely populated cities
A melting pot of cultures, cuisines, and languages
funFacts: Jakarta is sinking at an alarming rate due to groundwater extraction.
The city is known for its traffic congestion and street food scene.

name: Manila
clues: Capital of the Philippines, known for its historic Intramuros district
One of the most densely populated cities in the world
funFacts: Manila is named after the 'nilad' plant, which grew along the riverbanks.
It was once called the 'Pearl of the Orient' during Spanish rule.

name: Dhaka
clues: Capital of Bangladesh, known for its bustling streets
One of the world's most densely populated cities
funFacts: Dhaka is called the 'Rickshaw Capital of the World' with over 1 million rickshaws.
The city has a rich history dating back to the Mughal era.

name: Islamabad
clues: Capital of Pakistan, known for its greenery and modern design
Home to Faisal Mosque, one of the largest mosques in the world
funFacts: Islamabad was designed by a Greek architect in the 1960s.
It is one of the safest and most organized cities in Pakistan.

name: Mumbai
clues: India's financial capital, home to Bollywood
Known for the Gateway of India and Marine Drive
funFacts: Mumbai is built on seven islands that were merged by the British.
Dabbawalas deliver over 200,000 lunchboxes daily with incredible accuracy.

name: Auckland
clues: Largest city in New Zealand, known as the 'City of Sails'
Built on over 50 dormant volcanoes
funFacts: Auckland has the highest boat ownership per capita in the world.
It is home to the tallest freestanding structure in the Southern Hemisphere, the Sky Tower.

name: Fiji
clues: An island nation in the South Pacific known for its crystal-clear waters
Famous for its coral reefs and friendly locals
funFacts: Fiji consists of over 300 islands, but only about 110 are inhabited.
The national drink, kava, is made from the root of a pepper plant and has a calming effect.

name: Zanzibar
clues: An archipelago off the coast of Tanzania, known for its spice trade
Home to Stone Town, a UNESCO World Heritage Site
funFacts: Zanzibar is nicknamed the 'Spice Island' due to its production of cloves, nutmeg, and cinnamon.
Freddie Mercury, the lead singer of Queen, was born in Zanzibar.
